page.title: 12THE MOATED GRANGE
page.content: {The Moated Grange}farm house is only 4 years old.How long the old house stood is not known for certain,but we think that it was built when the Domesday book was being written.Mr P Smith is the owner having inherited it from his father Mr A Smith.Previosly the farm belonged to the Campions family.At the front of the farm there is a moat.The end of which was at one time used for dipping sheep.This is marked on some ordnance survey maps as an ancient monument.During the second World War a small contingent of RAF personnal were stationed on the farm to operate a radar station.The farm buildings are a mixture of young and old.The most recent is a new drier storage bin which is under construction.The farms livestock consists of 130 cows,24 sheep,30 ducks,30 chickens,1 horse.
